For all other use contact the Special Collections Librarian, Hoskins Library, University of Tennessee, 1401 Cumberland Avenue, Knoxville, TN 37996. (865) 974-4480.

bibl.title: [Legal] 1794 Aug. 15, Territory of the US south of the Ohio River [to] Justices of Hawkins [County] / David Campbell
bibl.author: Campbell, David
bibl.note: This is a court order from David Campbell dated August 15, 1794. Campbell, a judge for the Territory south of the Ohio River, is ordering the Justices of Hawkins County to send him the documents involving John King versus John Collinsworth.

projectDesc.p: Created for the University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread.
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

keywords.term: Territory of the United States South of the River Ohio

address.addrLine: To the Justices of the County Court of Pleas & Quarter Sessions of Hawkins

div.p:
Whereas John King
Junr Junior lately before you impleaded John Collinsworth in an Action of Tresspass Trespass and thereupon before you obtained Judgement for the sum of three hundred Dollars against the said John Collinsworth And we being desirous for certain reasons that the said record should be certifyed certified to us__

We Command you that you send under your hands seals the said record of the said Recovery with all things touching the same into our Superior Court of Law to be held for the District of Washington in
Jonesbro Jonesboro
on the third Monday in September next plainly and destincly distinctly and in as full and ample manner as now remains before you together with this writ before the Judges of our said Court so that they on the part of the said John King may be able to proceed to the execution of the said Judgement and ordain what shall appear of right ought to be done Witness David Campbell Esquire
One of the Judges for the Territory of the United States South of Ohio__
